page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Situated on the outskirts of an industrial belt this area is mainly fields many of which are used by farmers for grazing sheep or cattle.In the centre is the village of Law,which is Gaelic for hill,and west of it is Overtown,another small village.Both villages were at one time connected with coal mining and one small private mine is still worked in Law. Originally council housing areas,both have now been expanded by private contractors.Each village has a Gospel Hall,Presbyterian Church,Primary School,Bowling Green and a bus service run by local operators.Overtown also has a garage offering servicing and petrol but Law has no such facility. The main railway line to the south passes close to both villages which are also bounded by 2 "A"class roads. Nearby is a General Hospital.
